1.english: When Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.
1.wedau: maranaina Yesu ana [finished] [directing] ana [twelve] tauvotaghotagho tauna [departed] au kampa da [teach] ma rau-guguyei au ahi [cities]
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.77); Strong secondary: Love

2.english: Now when John heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples
2.wedau: ina marana maranaina john [heard] au  deri  [works] ana Keriso tauna vivohi [two] ana ana tauvotaghotagho

3.english: and said to him, “Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?”
3.wedau: ma riwa da tauna [“are] omi tauna aiyai neꞌi bo ina ita [look] yamna [another?”]

4.english: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:
4.wedau: Yesu [answered] hita [“go] ma riwehi john  [things] aiyai omi [hear] ma [see:]

5.english: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
5.wedau: [blind] [receive] ahi [sight]  [lame] [walk]  opina pagapagana  [cleansed]  [deaf] [hear]  [dead]  [raised] au ma  apoapoena ana [good] vouna rau-guguyei da hita

6.english: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”
6.wedau: nuwaboyei  tauna aiyai [finds] egha [occasion] yamna [stumbling] au [me”]

7.english: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
7.wedau: ina nae ahi parata Yesu [began] da riwa da  [multitudes] [concerning] john [“what] rura omi nae hopu au  mutuyuwa da [see?]  [reed] [shaken] au  [wind?]
7.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.64); Strong secondary: Love

8.english: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
8.wedau: tuna aiwaꞌi rura omi nae hopu da [see?]  oroto au [soft] [clothing?] [behold] raketana aiyai [wear] [soft] [clothing]  au [kings’] numa

9.english: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
9.wedau: tuna yamna rura omi nae [out?] da inana  [prophet?] [yes] tau riwehi omi ma [much] ghe vavahagha da  peroveta

10.english: For this is he, of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’
10.wedau: yamna ina  tauna ana aiyai tauna  [written] [‘behold] tau vivohi au [messenger] naona ami [face] aiyai ina warihagha ami parata naona [you’]

11.english: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.
11.wedau: anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi [among] raketana aiyai  [born] ana vaivinehi kampa ana egha [arisen] [anyone] [greater] da john  [baptizer;] [yet] tauna aiyai  [least] au  vibadana ana marei  [greater] da tauna
11.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.76); Strong secondary: Wisdom

12.english: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.
12.wedau: I au  maratom ana john  [baptizer] [until] ina marana  vibadana ana marei [suffers] [violence] ma  [violent] varahai tauna au [force]
12.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.89); Strong secondary: Justice

13.english: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

14.english: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.
14.wedau: tora omi  ghohaghohana da [receive] tauna ina  [elijah] aiyai  da neꞌi

15.english: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
15.wedau: tauna aiyai ana [ears] da [hear] ita tauna [hear]

16.english: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions
16.wedau: [“but] da aiwaꞌi ina tau [compare] ina [generation?] tauna  [like] natunatuna [sitting] au  [marketplaces] aiyai ghorehi da ahi [companions]

17.english: and say, ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’
17.wedau: ma riwa [‘we] [played]  [flute] yamna omi ma omi [didn’t] [dance] ita nuwanuwaboyei yamna omi ma omi [didn’t] [lament’]

18.english: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
18.wedau: yamna john neꞌi [neither] [eating] [nor] [drinking] ma tauhi riwa [‘he] ana  [demon’]

19.english: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”
19.wedau: I  natuna ana oroto neꞌi [eating] ma [drinking] ma tauhi riwa [‘behold]  [gluttonous] oroto ma  [drunkard]  [friend] ana [tax] [collectors] ma [sinners!’] tuna [wisdom]  [justified] au ana [children”]
19.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.82); Strong secondary: Justice

20.english: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.
20.wedau: maratagogi tauna [began] da [denounce]  [cities] au aiyai anatapuhi ana ana [mighty] [works] ana  [done] yamna tauhi [didn’t] wanavira-meyemi

21.english: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
21.wedau: [“woe] da omi [chorazin!] [woe] da omi [bethsaida!] yamna tora  [mighty] [works] ana  [done] au [tyre] ma [sidon] aiyai  [done] au omi tauhi ina ana wanavira-meyemi [long] [ago] au [sackcloth] ma [ashes]

22.english: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.
22.wedau: tuna tau riwehi omi tauna ina  ghe vavahagha [tolerable] yamna [tyre] ma [sidon] au  mara ana [judgment] da yamna omi

23.english: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until today.
23.wedau: omi kapernaum aiyai  [exalted] da marei omi ina nae au da ana yamna tora  [mighty] [works] ana  [done] au [sodom] aiyai  [done] au omi tauna ina ana [remained] [until] [today]

24.english: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you.”
24.wedau: tuna tau riwehi omi raketana tauna ina  ghe vavahagha [tolerable] yamna  [land] ana [sodom] au  mara ana [judgment] da yamna [you”]

25.english: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.
25.wedau: au raketana mara Yesu [answered] [“i] [thank] omi Tamatei Guyau ana marei ma dobuna raketana omi [hid] ina [things] au  [wise] ma [understanding] ma [revealed] hita da [infants]
25.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.85); Strong secondary: Love

26.english: Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.
26.wedau: [yes] Tamatei yamna yamna tauna  [well-pleasing] au ami [sight]
26.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

27.english: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.
27.wedau: anatapuhi [things] ana  [delivered] da tau au au Tamatei egha [one] haramaneꞌi  natuna [except]  [father;] [neither] rura [anyone] haramaneꞌi  Tamatei [except]  natuna ma tauna da aiyai  natuna [desires] da [reveal] tauna

28.english: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.
28.wedau: [“come] da tau anatapuhi omi aiyai [labor] ma  [heavily] [burdened] ma tau ina verei omi [rest]

29.english: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.
29.wedau: varahai au [yoke] [upon] omi ma [learn] au tau yamna tau [am] [gentle] ma [humble] au [heart;] ma omi ina [find] [rest] yamna ami [souls]
29.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.75); Strong secondary: Justice

30.english: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”
